articles.author: Maya Gebeily, Laila Bassam
articles.description: It was the first attack within city limits as Israel escalated hostilities against Iran's allies in the region.
articles.title: Apartment building in Beirut hit as Israel widens air campaign

articles.author: Francois Murphy
articles.description: Austria's far-right Freedom Party (FPO) must on Monday seek to clear a path to power after its historic parliamentary election victory left the anti-establishment outfit needing a partner to form a governing coalition.
articles.title: Austrian far right seeks path to power through rivals' blockade

articles.author: Louis Van Boxel-Woolf
articles.description: Picknicking with friends in the park after prayers at a Vienna mosque, Saima Arab, a 20-year-old pedicurist originally from Afghanistan, is thankful for her freedoms in Austria.
articles.title: Austria's rightward shift puts immigration in crosshairs

articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: The United States has dropped a push for the U.N. Security Council to ask for a plan to transform a security mission in Haiti - helping fight armed gangs - into a formal U.N. peacekeeping operation, a move made to appease Russia and China, diplomats say.
articles.title: US drops push for Haiti peacekeeping plan to appease China, Russia

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The bomb that Israel used to kill Hezbollah leader Sayyed Hassan Nasrallah in Beirut last week was an American-made guided weapon, a U.S. senator said on Sunday.
articles.title: Israel used US-made bomb in attack on Hezbollah head, US senator says

articles.author: Alexander Tanas
articles.description: A senior government minister urged Moldovans on Sunday to shun "thieves, fugitives and bandits" after an exiled pro-Russian business magnate pledged to pay voters to vote "no" in a referendum on joining the European Union.
articles.title: Moldovan minister urges voters to shun 'thieves' after cash offered in EU referendum

articles.author: Kinda Makieh, Firas Makdesi
articles.description: Flags flew at half-mast in Damascus on Sunday and residents said they were still shocked after the killing of Hezbollah's chief Sayyed Hassan Nasrallah, whose fighters helped Syria's army reclaim large parts of the country during its brutal civil war.
articles.title: Syrians mourn Hezbollah leader killed in Israeli strike

articles.author: Trevor Hunnicutt
articles.description: Kamala Harris' U.S. presidential election campaign raised $55 million during two events this weekend, a campaign official said on Sunday.
articles.title: Harris campaign raises $55 mln over two weekend events, campaign official says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Japan's incoming prime minister, Shigeru Ishiba, will fill key party posts on Monday followed by a new Cabinet on Tuesday as he tries to unite his party after one of the ruling LDP's closest ever leadership races and ahead of a general election.
articles.title: Japan's incoming PM Ishiba fills posts after close leadership race

articles.author: John Revill
articles.description: As the Swiss National Bank's new chairman Martin Schlegel takes office this week, the jury is out on the central bank's handling of the Credit Suisse crash and its takeover by UBS .
articles.title: New Swiss central bank chief takes charge in shadow of Credit Suisse trauma
